Vulnerability.Title: Cookieless Authentication Enabled
Vulnerability.Description:
Cookieless authentication option is enabled. This can cause your session to be displayed on URL and makes your session insecure.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms cookieless="UseCookies">

References

  • http://www.developerfusion.com/article/6745/top-10-application-security-vulnerabilities-in-webconfig-files-part-two/2/
  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1d3t3c61.aspx

Vulnerability.Title: Cookieless Authentication may be enabled
Vulnerability.Description:
Your configuration only use cookies if the client's device profile supports cookies, otherwise cookies are not used.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms cookieless="UseCookies">

Vulnerability.Title: Doesn't Require SSL for Auth. Cookies
Vulnerability.Description:
Your configuration allows authentication cookies to be transferred in clear-text form. An attacker that can be able to monitor your network, can easily steal your session.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms requireSSL="true">

References

  • http://www.developerfusion.com/article/6745/top-10-application-security-vulnerabilities-in-webconfig-files-part-two/3/
  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1d3t3c61.aspx

Vulnerability.Title: Non-Unique Authentication Cookie Used
Vulnerability.Description:
Form based authentication feature of ASP.NET provides .ASPXAUTH for authentication cookie default. If you have more then one application at your web server and all of them uses the same name for authentcation cookie then an attacker that have authenticated any application on the web server, gains access all applications.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms name="{abcd}">

References

  • http://www.developerfusion.com/article/6745/top-10-application-security-vulnerabilities-in-webconfig-files-part-two/5/
  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1d3t3c61.aspx

Vulnerability.Title: Sliding Expiration Used
Vulnerability.Description:
Sliding Expiration disables timeouts for ASP.NET sessions. If it is set to false, after the timeout interval, user must re-login to application with credentials. If it is set to true, then if an attackers steals cookie can use it for gainin access to the application with the cookie's owner's permissions.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms slidingExpiration="true">

References

  • http://www.developerfusion.com/article/6745/top-10-application-security-vulnerabilities-in-webconfig-files-part-two/4/
  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1d3t3c61.aspx

Vulnerability.Title: Liberal Path Defined
Vulnerability.Description:
Your application's cookie path is defined liberal. It means that cookie will be valid and related whole domain. Restrict the cookie to the specific directories on application to reduce risk about cookie related issues.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms path="{abcd}">

References

  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1d3t3c61.aspx
  • http://my.opera.com/yngve/blog/show.dml/388840

Vulnerability.Title: URL Redirection is enabled
Vulnerability.Description:
Your configuration allows to make URL Redirections. If your applications have an URL Redirection vulnerability, this option can protect you and your clients from phishing or related spoofing attacks.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms enableCrossAppRedirects="false">

References

  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1d3t3c61.aspx
  • http://www.pashabitz.com/PermaLink,guid,c5dacb0f-2b74-485f-abe9-296142a414ac.aspx

Vulnerability.Title: Your form tickets are not both encrypted-validated
Vulnerability.Description:
Your configuration allows transportation of your cookies both of not-encrypted and not-validated. This can lead an attacker to perform session hijacking, eavesdropping, session/cookie tampering and related issues.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms protection="All">

References

  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/1d3t3c61.aspx
  • http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms998310.aspx

Vulnerability.Title: Your form tickets are not validated
Vulnerability.Description:
Your configuration makes your cookies transported in an encrypted form but doesn't validate them. This can lead an attacker to tamper session/cookie.

Secure Configuration

<configuration>
   <system.web>
      <authentication mode="Forms">
        <forms protection="All">
